````{R carga}
DF = read.table("01A_AlzheimerDisease.txt", header = TRUE, sep = "\t", dec = ".", check.names = FALSE)

````

````{R variables}
tabla_variables = data.frame(variable = colnames(DF), tipo= c(
  rep("numerical", 14),
  "integer",
  rep("numerical", 12),
  "char",
  "numerical",
  rep("char",2)))
````

````{R limpieza}
var_categoricas <- colnames(DF)[!sapply(DF, is.numeric)]
print(var_categoricas)

##EDAD SALE ALGO RARO, SALEN TODOS CON VALOR 0,98 , HAY QUE TENER CUIDADO CON ESTA VARIABLE PORQUE IGUAL SESGA LOS RESULTADOS
````
  
````{r CTES, ECHO = TRUE}
summary(DF[,tabla_variables$variable[tabla_variables$tipo == "numerical"]])

mySD = apply(DF[, tabla_variables$variable[tabla_variables$tipo == "numerical"]], 2, sd)

myMU = colMeans(DF[,tabla_variables$variable[tabla_variables$tipo == "numerical"]])
myCV = mySD/myMU
sort(myCV)

apply(DF[,tabla_variables$variable[tabla_variables$tipo == "binary"]], 2, table, useNA = "i")

apply(DF[,tabla_variables$variable[tabla_variables$tipo == "categorical"]], 2, table, useNA = "i")

apply(DF[,tabla_variables$variable[tabla_variables$tipo == "categorical"]], 2,
      function (x) round(100*table(x)/sum(table(x)), 2))



````
````{R SUBSET}
DFsub2 = subset(DF, select = -c(CgA))
DF = subset(DF, select = -c(CgA))
tabla_variables = subset(tabla_variables, variable != "CgA")
````

````{r factor}
DF$gender = factor(DF$diagnosis)
DF$diagnosis = factor(DF$diagnosis)
````

````{r anomalo, echo = TRUE}
boxplot(DFsub2[, tabla_variables$variable[tabla_variables$tipo == "numerical"]], las = 2)
````
